pageTitle: New escalator to improve Vauxhall Station
description: The works are being carried out by Metronet BCV.The station is expected to operate as normal during the closure.The fixed staircase which goes down to the Victoria line platforms will be closed to the public for a period of approximately seven months

title.title: New escalator to improve Vauxhall Station

texts: Engineering works to install a new escalator in place of the existing fixed staircase at Vauxhall station will begin on Monday, 27 June 2005.
Engineering works will commence on Monday 27 June 2005 and are due to end on 3 February 2006
The works are being carried out by Metronet BCV.
The station is expected to operate as normal during the closure.
The fixed staircase which goes down to the Victoria line platforms will be closed to the public for a period of approximately seven months while it is being replaced by an escalator.
Engineering works will commence on Monday 27 June 2005 and are due to end on 3 February 2006.
The new escalator will only run downwards until congestion work is completed in the ticket hall in 2007/2008. It will then become reversible.
For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call: 020 7222 1234 or visit TfL's website .

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Over 44,000 people use Vauxhall station each weekday","Vauxhall Station first opened on 23 July 1971 on the newly built Victoria line","The Victoria line carries over 500,000 people each weekday","Metronet Rail BCV is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Bakerloo, Central, Victoria and Waterloo \u0026 City lines","TfL is investing Â£10 billion over the next 5 years to improve and expand London's transport network, over half of that in the Tube."]}
